abstract.para: &podman; is a container engine to easily deploy and run containerized workloads available in container image repositories. &podman; provides a command line interface to manage containers. This article describes how to autostart &podman; containers after the host system reboot.

topic.para: The --restart option of the podman run command can restart a container after it exits. However, it does not restart the container after the host system reboots.
&podman; can create a &systemd; service for each existing container. After you enable such service, the container starts on every system boot.

procedure.title: Creating and enabling a container service as a non-&rootuser; user

step.para: Identify the container that you want to start on system boot.
step.screen: &prompt.user;podman ps CONTAINER ID IMAGE [...] NAMES 9a0fdeee9320 registry.opensuse.org/.../cockpit-ws:latest cockpit-ws

step.para: Create a &systemd; unit file for the service related to the cockpit-ws container and save it as container-cockpit-ws.service in the current directory.
Move the &systemd; unit file to ~/.config/systemd/user/ in the user's home directory.
Make &systemd; aware of the previously created unit file.

Because the service is run by a non-&rootuser; user, you need to make sure that the user is logged in at boot and stays active even after they are logged out from a display manager or a terminal session.
